---
slug: /229
title: "This Week In React #229: React Conf, React Router, Next.js Adapters, Redwood, Apollo, Fastify, Vite, Waku | RN v0.79, Deep Imports, Builder Bob, Fingerprinting | TC39, Tailwind, Rspack, Rstest, Turborepo, Bun"
authors: [kacperkapusciak, tomekzaw]
date: 04-09-2025
---
Hi everyone!
This week, I'm excited to introduce 2 new contributors to help me with the newsletter!

**Tomasz and Kacper from [Software Mansion](https://swmansion.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)** here â€“ you may already know us from libraries like Reanimated or Gesture Handler. We're happy to be among the authors of the This Week in React newsletter!

segments.source_content: We were about to call it a fairly calm weekâ€¦ until React Conf 2025 was officially announced and React Native 0.79 dropped with Swift-compatible native modules for iOS, faster app startup on Android, and many more. Let's dive in!

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor1}
[![React-admin: Yes, You Could Build It Yourselfâ€¦ But Why?](/emails/issues/229/marmelab.jpg)](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/)
**[React-admin: Yes, You Could Build It Yourselfâ€¦ But Why?](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/)**
You didnâ€™t spend years mastering React just to build CRUD apps on repeat. Yet here you areâ€”facing another request for an admin panel and questioning your life choices.

We've been there ourselves. Thatâ€™s why we built [**react-admin**](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/)â€”an open-source framework that handles the boring parts (data fetching, forms, auth, permissionsâ€¦) so you can focus on the real dev work.
Powered by **Material UI, react-hook-form, react-router, react-query, and TypeScript**, it lets you build admins on top of any REST/GraphQL APIâ€”fast.

translations.zh-hant: åŸºæ–¼ **Material UIã€react-hook-formã€react-routerã€react-query å’Œ TypeScript**ï¼Œè®“æ‚¨èƒ½åœ¨ä»»ä½• REST/GraphQL API ä¸Šå¿«é€Ÿå»ºæ§‹ç®¡ç†ç³»çµ±ã€‚

segments.source_content: So next time your PM asks for a new dashboard, skip the existential crisis. [Just use react-admin.](https://github.com/marmelab/react-admin)
## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![React Conf 2025](/emails/issues/229/react-conf-2025.png)](https://conf.react.dev/)
**[React Conf is back for 2025](https://conf.react.dev/)**
The React conference is happening on October 7-8, 2025 in Henderson, Nevada, ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ US. Itâ€™s where the React & React Native team shares official announcements live.

segments.source_content: The only way to attend the conference in person is to win a ticket lottery that lets you purchase up to 2 tickets. Fortunately, if youâ€™re not one of the lucky ones, the event will be livestreamed for free.

- ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - Good taste makes great products: Simple design principles every engineer should know](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr9)
- ğŸ“£ [The Future of Redwood Launches Today](https://community.redwoodjs.com/t/the-future-of-redwood-launches-today/7938): The former project gets renamed to Redwood GraphQL and enters maintenance mode. [RedwoodSDK](https://redwoodjs.com/) is the new path for the framework under new leadership.
- ğŸ’¬ [Next.js RFC â€“ Deployment Adapters API](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions/77740): Vercel plans to support adapters to deploy Next.js to any hosting provider.
- ğŸ¦ [Tanner Linsley â€“ TanStack Router \`intent\` preloading will predict where your users cursor will go](https://x.com/tannerlinsley/status/1908723776650355111)
- ğŸ” [React Router and the Remixâ€™ed path](https://zhero-web-sec.github.io/research-and-things/react-router-and-the-remixed-path): Vulnerability discovered affecting both React Router and Remix, a flaw for a potential DoS attack through cache poisoning.
- ğŸ“œ [React for Two Computers](https://overreacted.io/react-for-two-computers/): Dan Abramov expands on his React Conf talk with fresh insights to help you build a solid mental model of React Server Components and their origins.
- ğŸ“œ [Advanced React in the Wild](https://largeapps.dev/case-studies/advanced/): A great case study outlining 5 companies that have significantly improved the performance metrics of their React & Next.js sites and how they did it.
- ğŸ“œ [React & live streaming: How to include video mixing in your app](https://blog.swmansion.com/react-live-streaming-how-to-include-video-mixing-in-your-app-c460e09da7a8). A short tutorial explaining how to mix live video with React syntax and stream the output directly from the browser.
- ğŸ“œ [Why We Moved off Next.js](https://documenso.com/blog/why-we-moved-off-next-js): Quick feedback from the Documenso project, moving from Next.js App Router to Vite and React Router.
- ğŸ“œ [React.memo Demystified: When It Helps and When It Hurts](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/react-memo-when-it-helps-when-it-hurts): A concise explanation of common misconceptions and hidden pitfalls of memoization.
- ğŸ“œ [React Reconciliation: The Hidden Engine Behind Your Components](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/react-reconciliation-deep-dive/): Practical guidelines and clean architecture tips to ensure best performance with React reconciler
- ğŸ“œ [Why you need a custom context provider](https://gabrielpichot.fr/blog/why-you-need-a-custom-context-provider/): A nice interactive article that shows creating a custom Context Provider wrapper component can reduce un-necessary re-renders.
- ğŸ’¸ [Supabase breaks the norms of traditional software architecture. Learn how.](https://go.clerk.com/pkKoKSg)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Router 7.5 â€“ new `route.lazy` API](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v750): Allows for more granular lazy loading.
- ğŸ“¦ [Cloudflare Vite Plugin 1.0](https://blog.cloudflare.com/introducing-the-cloudflare-vite-plugin/): Brings official support for React Router v7. Leverages Vite v6 Environment API so that your local dev server matches the production Cloudflare Workers runtime.
- ğŸ“¦ [Fastify React 1.0](https://github.com/fastify/fastify-vite/releases/tag/react-v1.0.0): This new package might help you assemble your custom React meta-framework based on the Fastify web server and Vite (creating your own â€œMini Next.jsâ€). It supports React 19, and RSCs will come later. See also the related launch post ([React Server Confusion](https://hire.jonasgalvez.com.br/2025/apr/8/react-server-confusion/)) which also gives a good overview of the state of RSC support outside Webpack.
- ğŸ“¦ [Apollo Client Next.js integration](https://www.apollographql.com/blog/apollo-client-integration-nextjs-officially-released): The experimental GraphQL client integration package is now officially stable, including a new implementation for `PreloadQuery` to help you avoid request waterfalls. Apollo Client v4 is now in alpha, and integration packages for React Router / TanStack Start being worked on.
- ğŸ“¦ [Waku 0.22 â€“ Announcing API routes](https://waku.gg/blog/api-routes)
- ğŸ“¦ [Astro 5.6 â€“ Global `astro:env` and experimental sessions on Cloudflare, experimental cookie-less sessions](https://astro.build/blog/astro-560/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Hydrogen â€“ March 2025 release â€“ Support for Vite 6, turn on Remix `v3_routeConfig` flag 6](https://hydrogen.shopify.dev/update/march-2025)
- ğŸ¥ [Theo â€“ A breakdown of style solutions for 2025](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lIUp8bdKiq4)
- ğŸ¥ [Youssef Benlemlih â€“ The Magic Of Compound Components in React](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WSM2MpJIwFg)

## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}
[![React Native 0.79](/emails/issues/229/react-native-0.79.png)](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2025/04/08/react-native-0.79)
**[React Native 0.79 â€“ Faster tooling and much more](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2025/04/08/react-native-0.79)**
Recently, the React Native core team switched to more frequent release cycles, so this is a smaller release, but nonetheless exciting in terms of performance improvements. Here are the highlights:

- Metro: 3x faster cold startup and package exports support
- JavaScriptCore (JSC) moving to a Community Package
- iOS: Swift-Compatible Native Modules registration
- Android: Faster app startup thanks to skipping the JS bundle compression
- Removal of Remote JS Debugging
